intro: Mesembryanthemum kovisimontanum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as thick, fleshy leaves for water storage. Its flowers are typically short-lived, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Mesembryanthemum kovisimontanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
